Reviews.Title: “Apartment”
Reviews.Author: Kelly S
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in the Apartment across the street at this location. Positives: Pretty good value for the money. The room was clean and spacious. Close walking distance to a nice square with bakery, coffee shop and grocery store. The staff were very helpful and friendly. They bring you breakfast in the morning! The coffee and croissants were great! Negatives: The beds were not very comfortable. Also note that if you stay in the apartment that the staff can come in and out of the apartment at any time to use the storage room in the front hallway. Please note however that they were very friendly with us, however we weren't given the option to put a "do not disturb" on the door which was a small annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “They over booked us!”
Reviews.Author: Ronim_lad
Reviews.Content: We turned up, and were told that "the hot water in your room doesn't work", so the daughter (?) took us for a short 5 min walk to another place, where there was a room available for us. This room was above a restaurant, of presumably her friend. She was very apologetic. The new room was lovely, big, great air con, mini fridge, tv, nice bathroom. Lovely! And a view of the canal. So we can't really comment on the rooms of the Doge, because we didn't stay there. But we did go back to the hotel in the morning for breakfast. We peeked into the rooms and they were small, comfortable looking, but we definately did better in the other place. We ended up having breakfast in their kitchenette area, not the best experience, no where to sit, but at least we got some food and coffee. The mother was very apologetic about "being fully booked" (so no problem with hot water), and didn't charge us the additional tax that we should have paid. Which was nice. I liked the look of Doge for a short stay. Great location for the train station, pleasant walk to all the big sights.

Reviews.Title: “There has to be better places for the money!”
Reviews.Author: zak0 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in July 2011. Although the location is a bit out of the way for the main tourist sights it is near the main station and there are plenty of boats. It is a very quite area... Unfortunately the staff were very abrupt. The woman at the reception desk (a counter under the stairs) took to shouting if you couldn't understand what she was saying - going on the premise that louder means clearer... Breakfast was basic to say the least. Served in the room at a time arranged the night before (if they remember - one morning I had to go and ask) - it was a pretty poor affair. Bad coffee and 2 bits of french toast with jam if you were lucky and a stale croissant. The room itself was fine if a little gloomy. The air-con worked great. The shower unfortunately was filthy and mouldy and the water backed up at an alarming rate. More than 4 minutes and the water was up to the lip of the shower tray! There have got to be better places than this to stay in Venice for the price. Very poor!

Reviews.Title: “Warning - please don't stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nebuta
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this horrible hotel. Don't get deceived by the overall reviews. Trust me, it's a starless hotel. Small, dingy and very rude daughter. They run a scam. They chrge u one price and give it for half to Europeans. This stay spoiled my Venice trip. I am literally begging people please please don't stay here. I would suggest not to stay near station. Stay in Rialto area or San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Decent spot in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: traveler323232
Reviews.Content: Spent three days here. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was huge. It was closer to an apartment than a hotel room. Very clean although the bed was a bit on the uncomfortable side. The location is great. It's far from St. Mark's and the really touristy areas. If you like to hang with the locals, the surrounding neighborhoods are where you want to be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & Clean Family-Run Hotel on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: Linavoce
Reviews.Content: Venice is expensive and since we are not the kind of travelers that hang out in our room, we wanted a good value, but no-frills hotel. We also like to speak the language of the country we are in. Items at the top of our travel list are, in order: 1. cleanliness 2. quiet sleep on decent beds and 3. As non-Tourist-y as possible. We found all that at Hotel Doge. The rooms are very small, but space is used efficiently. We had a queen-sized bed, a wardrobe w/plenty of space to hang clothing, and our own bathroom. All was incredibly clean and the whole place has been recently remodeled. Bathroom fixtures were new, & great shower w/plenty of pressure & hot water. The family is very friendly and helpful. The parents do not speak English but the eldest daughter does and is very present. Continental breakfast is included and served in your room. An added bonus is that this place is only about 10 mins walk from the main train/bus station (Piazzale Roma) and (important to us) far away from the throngs of tourists in San Marco sestiere. It was relatively quiet from about 11 pm to 7 am, and there are many very good trattorias and pizzerias nearby. Plus, it feels like a real neighborhood. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Really welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: farmerwadey
Reviews.Content: I stay in too many hotels. But it is rare to find ones with staff who are genuinely friendy and welcoming. But here they were great. They were not aloof or pompous as so many hotels staff seem to think their customers seek neither. This is a down to earth but comfortable hotel. It is near the train station wityh good river bus connections; a fair but enjoyable walk to the main sights. The hotel is a little quirky, and there have been some rather odd peices of decorating, but that just adds to the charm. The breakfast is delivered to your door each day on a tray - as their is no restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, affordable price”
Reviews.Author: igorek
Reviews.Content: Great location: ~5min from train station and ~1min from vaporetto stop; but google the location first. Nice , helpful staff: the receptionist even showed our room in person. Everything is minuscule as expected in the old city. Breakfast is served directly to the room. Clean, well maintained room, recently remodeled. I paid 100E/night for double room thru expedia.com

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: marcus_cz
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in Venice early in March. Hotel Doge proved to be nice if somewhat basic place to stay. I booked single room, which was small but this did not mattered much to me, because i basically wanted a bed to sleep. My booking did not included breakfast which is otherwise served into rooms. Toilet and shower was shared - on the floor, clean and good. Hotel is located nearby railway station, perhaps not most scenic or athospheric part of Venice, but fine anyway. With direction posted on booking sites or hotel website there is no problem to find it. Just follow you nose from Scalzi bridge into narrow street straight ahead and then look for small sings on wall "Albergo Doge". All in all, if you look for nice and simple place just for a few night sleep, Doge is one of good alternatives to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Got out of there Quickly!”
Reviews.Author: LRGE
Reviews.Content: We booked the Doge Hotel online and stayed only one night (we left and found better lodging) in July 2006. It is situated in a non-tourist area and it is a trek to all tourist sights. Few amenities were available nearby. The hotel gave us a very small room that was dank and stuffy. The air conditioner did not work properly. People were leaving their doors open to their rooms lending a tenement atmosphere to the small hotel. The lights in our very dark room were dim and/or not working. The hotel "serves" breakfast but there was no common eating area and the room was so small that one would have had to eat breakfast on the bed; there was simply no table and only one chair for two people. The few tourist brocheres available at the desk were outdated and useless. It was a very uncomfortable and inadequate stay.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but must be better options”
Reviews.Author: Available
Reviews.Content: I had a very tiny single room on the top floor that looked like an add-on to the original building or a converted closet. It was without bath or even wash basin, and it appeared that there was only one bathroom to share and that was on the floor below. Continental breakfast was brought to your room since they do not have a breakfast room. It was a budget option, which does not leave you with much choice in Venice. Convenient location to the bus station at Piazzale Roma, but I probably would not stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Doge Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Santa Croce, 1222, 30133 Venice, Italy
